title: IMU - Past and Present: History and Archives of the International Mathematical Union
snippet: The first General Assembly of the IMU was held in Strasbourg in 1920, simultaneously with the first post-war International Congress of Mathematicians (ICM). Delegates from eleven countries, all Allied Powers, were present. It was decided to invite neutral countries to join the Union. In contrast, ex-enemies Germany, Austria, Hungary and Bulgaria were explicitly barred from membership.
